Posts.Content: Jun 27, 2008 06:25AM pondfrogs wrote: I am so sorry that this is happening to you. sending prayers your way.
Posts.Title: Here I Go Again? msvirgo828 redheadace1

Posts.Content: Sep 13, 2009 09:06AM pondfrogs wrote: when I found out I had bc in one breast the surgeon asked me what I wanted to do..remove one or both. I immediatly answered both. my mom died of bc 20 yrs ago. I said I did not want to go thru' it again with the 2nd one down the road or be worried about it. I also wanted immed reconstruction and wanted them to look as even as possible. I have met people who only had one done and got it in the other later. to be fair I also have met some that have not. I have never regretted my decision. I feel like I made the best choice for me.
Posts.Title: What made you decide . . . Mantra Mantra

Posts.Content: May 5, 2008 09:03AM pondfrogs wrote: osufan, you sound like me!  I have jsut completed my a/c tx's last week and they have been hell!  extreme nausea/vomiting/aches. I had to be hospitalized after the second tx for severe n/v. my anti-emetics have been changed so much I have a pharmacy supply company in my closet lol.  the thing that finally kept it half way decent was a combo of ativan and reglan (along with other 'as needed' stuff). now I will start taxol in 2 weeks. my onc told me she didn't think that the taxol would be as bad as the a/c. hopefully it won't as I will be getting taxol every week x 12 weeks and I know won't be able to take it if it is. I also have expanders and will be getting my new implants sometime in sept. after all this chemo and my body has a chance to recover.
Posts.Title: Taxotere side effects vs. A/C effects osufan otter

Posts.Content: Apr 2, 2008 09:19AM pondfrogs wrote: thanks for the warm welcomes. I am so glad I came across this site....it is a wonderful community. on a bright note my daughter is expecting on the 21st. I saw her yesterday and she looks like she is ready to pop LOL. I told her to have the baby this week not next week as it is chemo week LOL. oh well, chemo or not I'll be there to welcome my grandbaby into this beautiful world
Posts.Title: Chemo starting Feb 2008? nowwhat cancerviking

Posts.Content: May 5, 2008 09:31AM pondfrogs wrote: I just finished my a/c tx's last week and will be starting taxol in 2 weeks. I will be getting them weekly for 12 weeks. my onc told me she didn't think they would be as hard on me as the a/c (severe n/v) but reading all of this I'm getting a little worried. I just don't think I can handle it if I am going to be as sick as I was with the a/c (and weekly to boot!). ugh!!
Posts.Title: Chemo starting Feb 2008? nowwhat cancerviking

Posts.Content: Mar 31, 2008 08:54AM pondfrogs wrote: I was dx on dec 21st '07. had bilat mast on feb 1st. started 1st chemo feb 25th. going for 3rd next tuesday. first one wasn't too bad..no vomiting just nausea. the second one really kicked my butt. lots of nausea/vomiting and had to be hospitalized for 2 days last week. am now on reglan/ativan and feeling lots better but really apprehensive about next weeks tx.
